Semaphores
[Real-Time Operation System]

Detailed Description

Provides RTOS semaphores.


Functions

HRESULT TCSemaphoreClose (uint32 semID)
 Close a sempahore.
HRESULT TCSemaphoreOpen (uint32 *semID, int32 count)
 Create a semaphore.
HRESULT TCSemaphoreReset (uint32 semID)
 Reset a semaphore.
HRESULT TCSemaphoreSignal (uint32 semID)
 Signals a sempahore.
HRESULT TCSemaphoreWait (uint32 semID)
 Wait for a semaphore.
HRESULT TCSemaphoreWaitTimeout (uint32 semID, uint32 msecs)
 Wait for a sempahore with timeout.

Function Documentation

HRESULT TCSemaphoreOpen (  uint32 *  semID,
int32  count
) 
 

Create a semaphore.

Parameters:
semID Address to place the ID of the semaphore in.
count The initial count of the semaphore.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCSemaphoreClose (  uint32  semID  ) 
 

Close a sempahore.

Parameters:
semID The ID of the semaphore to close.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCSemaphoreReset (  uint32  semID  ) 
 

Reset a semaphore.

Parameters:
semID The ID of the semaphore to reset.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCSemaphoreSignal (  uint32  semID  ) 
 

Signals a sempahore.

Parameters:
semID The ID of the semaphore to signal.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCSemaphoreWait (  uint32  semID  ) 
 

Wait for a semaphore.

Parameters:
semID The ID of the semaphore to wait on.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) or an error code.

HRESULT TCSemaphoreWaitTimeout (  uint32  semID,
uint32  msecs
) 
 

Wait for a sempahore with timeout.

Parameters:
semID The ID of the semaphore to wait on.
msecs TC_WAIT_FOREVER, TC_NO_WAIT or timeout time in milliseconds.
Returns:
NO_ERROR (0) if successful, E_SEMAPHORE_TIMEOUT if a timeout occured.
